snippet: The directive applies to United Airlines, the only American carrier using the new plane, after several safety incidents in recent weeks.
abstract: Federal Aviation Administration grounds all Boeing 787s operated by United States carriers until it can determine what caused new type of battery to catch fire on two planes in nine days; directive applies to United Airlines, only American carrier using new plane.

byline.original: By CHRISTOPHER DREW, JAD MOUAWAD and MATTHEW L. WALD
byline.contributor: Hiroko Tabuchi contributed reporting from Tokyo, Sruthi Gottipati from New Delhi and Bettina Wassener from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: The directive applies to United Airlines, the only American carrier using the new plane, after several safety incidents in recent weeks.

headline.seo: F.A.A. Orders Grounding of U.S.-Operated Boeing 787s
